coding_practice.title: 132 Pattern
coding_practice.description:
Given an array of n integers nums, a 132 pattern is a subsequence of three integers nums[i], nums[j] and nums[k] such that i < j < k and nums[i] < nums[k] < nums[j].

Return true if there is a 132 pattern in nums, otherwise, return false.

examples.explanation: There is no 132 pattern in the sequence.
There is a 132 pattern in the sequence: [1, 4, 2].
There are three 132 patterns in the sequence: [-1, 3, 2], [-1, 3, 0] and [-1, 2, 0].

coding_practice.explanation:
1. 從右向左遍歷 nums，用 stack 保存可能的 nums[j]。
2. s3 保存目前最大的 nums[k]，使其小於 nums[j]。
3. 當遇到 num < s3 時，找到 132 pattern，返回 True。
4. 否則，更新 stack 和 s3。
5. 遍歷結束後若未找到，返回 False。
